A billionaire plans on venturing to the Titanic wreckage, one year after the catastrophic event that killed five. Ohio real estate investor, Larry Connor will travel down in a 2-person submarine where the infamous ship went down. Created by Triton Submarines, the vessel costs an estimated $20 million. There is no planned date for when the expedition will take place. #news #submarine #titanic #oceangate #tritonsubmarines #billionaire #shipwreck #deepsea
voice_to_text: A billionaire is attempting to see the Titanic wreckage just one year after Oceangate's failed submarine expedition. Real estate agent Larry Connor wants to prove the safety surrounding deep sea diving by traveling 2.3 miles in a two person vessel estimated to cost $20 million. There's no word on when the Triton 4,002 Abyssal Explorer will make the voyage. This news comes one year after five people were killed when Ocean Gates Titan submarine imploded on its journey down to the wreckage.

Another house in Rodanthe on North Carolina's #OBX has collapsed into the ocean. Full story on 13NewsNow.com
voice_to_text: Believe it or not, 12 hours ago, that debris was actually a house situated on the beach here in Rodanthe along the Outer Banks of North Carolina. So what you're looking at is actually sixth house that is collapsed here in the verdante community in North Carolina just over the last four years. We're also told this is just about 10% of the total debris from that house collapse last night. And we're told the debris from this latest house collapse stretches miles here along the Outer Banks of North Carolina. There are roughly 45 National Park Service staff. They're helping clean up the debris along the beaches. But here is where the dilemma is. Insurance companies will cover the cost of the house if it is destroyed because it falls into the ocean, but they will not proactively cover the cost of moving the house away from the ocean before it sinks in. But as you could see here along Ocean Drive in Redanthe, there were still other houses with the same problem and they are not going away.

And just as we're recovering from the pandemic, the war in Ukraine drove up everyone's energy bills, grappling with inflation. And it was a really tough time for everyone. But I'm determined to make sure that people feel when the election comes that the future is better, that we have turned a corner. And I think at the start of this year you can see that that is beginning to happen. Inflation is fallen from 11% to just over 3%. The other week. Taxes are being cut by £900 for an average worker. Kicking into people's pay slips. Next week, energy bills are falling. And we can get a sense that the future is gonna be brighter for people and their families. They can have that piece of mind and that confidence. And that's what I've worked incredibly hard to deliver. Rishi Sunak discusses the challenges faced by the British people, including the pandemic, Ukraine war and rising energy bills. They emphasize the importance of delivering a better future for the British people, highlighting the recent decrease in inflation, tax cuts and energy bills. What do you think about it? Share your views in the comments. If you like the video, let us know in the comments section. And for more videos like this, follow us on TikTok.

video_description: Houston Overnight News Recap: May 26, 2024
voice_to_text: This is some of the news you may have missed this Memorial Day weekend in Houston. On Saturday morning, a man was struck and killed by another vehicle while changing his tire in the service road of the Katy Freeway near Highway 6. The other driver remained at the scene and police are investigating the accident. On Saturday night around ten forty five PM, a shooting left a juvenile grazed by a bullet at the Missionary Village Apartments in south east Houston. Police say a vehicle pulled up and an argument took place. The argument turned physical which then turned into a shootout. Several people were also injured in the chaos by debris and broken glass. Across town in southwest Houston, a five year old girl was also grazed by a bullet after a fight broke out outside of a party hall around midnight. She is expected to be okay as well. Today. Another shooting took place outside of a Waffle House in northwest Harris County around 4:00am. One person was transported to a local hospital. At 5:00am, a fatal accident occurred in the northbound lanes of the Southwest Freeway just before the 6:10 split. One person was pronounced deceased at the scene.

video_description: Pegi Setiawan alias Perong, membantah terlibat dan menjadi otak peristiwa Vina Cirebon usai pihak Direktorat Reserse Kriminal Jawa Barat memberikan konferensi pers, Minggu (26/5). "Izin bicara, saya tidak pernah melakukan itu. Saya rela mati," kata Pegi singkat. Pegi sebelumnya ditangkap pada Selasa (21/5) di kawasan Jalan Kopo, Kota Bandung, Jawa Barat, pada Selasa (21/5) pukul 18.23 WIB setelah buron 8 tahun.  Selama menjadi buron, pria asal Cirebon tersebut bekerja sebagai buruh bangunan dan sempat bersembunyi di Katapang, Kabupaten Bandung dengan identitas Robi Irawan dengan ayah kandungnya. 📸: Dok. kumparan. #newsupdate #update #news #vidol #vinacirebon #pegisetiawan #perong#pelaku #cirebon #bandung #info #infoterkini #berita #beritaterkini #kumparan #tiktokberita

video_description: Kenya Becomes Major US Ally #usa #kenya  Kenya is now the US’ newest major ally. They are the first sub-Saharan nation to receive the designation of Non-NATO Major Ally and they are the 20th nation to get it. This will allow them to obtain better weapons and have closer security cooperation. Why Kenya though? Well, Kenya has been a key part of American counterterrorism forces in East Africa. They are also part of the Ukrainian defense contact group and have deployed police officers to Haiti. This will be Biden’s 3rd formal ally - behind Qatar and Colombia. Kenya will also be the 4th African nation to become a major US ally alongside Morocco, Tunisia, and Egypt.

Kabar terbaru, berita acara pemeriksaan (BAP) terhadap delapan dari 11 pelaku yang ditangkap yakni ER, HS, JY, ES, SP, SK, SD, dan RW dianggap penuh kejanggalan.  #KasusVina #PembunuhanVina #JernihkanHarapan

The footage shows a Ukrainian soldier with down syndrome named vokorov nearly causing the entire squad to perish due to a mortar operation mishap. According to Ukrainian media, Ukraine is currently facing shortages not only in ammunition, but also in qualified personnel. The video reveals that Volkarov, under the taunting of veteran soldiers, was instructed to operate a mortar. Unfortunately, he loaded the shell incorrectly, almost leading to a catastrophe. Afterward, unaware of his mistake, Volkarov was verbally and physically abused by the veterans, leaving him terrified and crying in the trench. War is brutal, and even for able bodied soldiers the survival rate on the front lines is low. For someone like Vokerov, who has down syndrome, escaping a tragic fate is even more unlikely. Sent to the front lines despite being unable to care for himself, Volkarov stands little chance of participating in combat and risks becoming cannon fodder. Rumors suggest that his comrades even considered using Volkarov to attract Russian drones, and one Ukrainian veteran reportedly wanted him to test for landmines. Vokorov's case has brought public attention and concern to the treatment of vulnerable soldiers within the Ukrainian military. Some Ukrainians hope that Russian forces will capture Vokorov, believing it might save him from further suffering.

Kansas City Chiefs kicker Harrison Butker is facing backlash online after a controversial graduation speech - in which he told women they should aspire to be homemakers.  People online are calling the speech demeaning to working women and also say it is mysogynstic.  A petition was even started to have him removed from the Super Bowl champion's roster, which has now reached over 100,000 signatures.  He also faced fire for quoting Taylor Swift in the same speech, as he plays for the same team as Travis Kelce, Taylor’s boyfriend. A pod of orcas sunk a yacht a few miles from the Strait of Gibraltar early Sunday. THe same pod of orcas has been toying with boats since 2020. #TODAYShow #Orcas
voice_to_text: It’s the kind of heart-stopping  wildlife encounter sailors dread. Killer whales ramming boats, at times breaking the rudders leaving the boats unsteerable or worse, sinking them. And now it's happened again. The crew of the 50-foot Alberon Coñac sailboat calling for help early Sunday, a few miles from the Strait of Gibraltar  in Moroccan waters, saying orcas damaged the rudder  and the yacht was taking on water. The crew rescued, the boat sank. The same pod of orcas have been toying with boats off the  Atlantic coast of Spain, Portugal, and France since 2020. More than 400 encounters sinking  at least five boats. This particular pod is critically endangered and scientists say returns to the same  area every year looking for bluefin tuna. Marine conservation group  Ocean Care stressing “We do not believe that the orcas’  behaviour is any form of revenge or a deliberate attack on people.” Experts think the orcas may actually be  teaching each other how to break boat rudders. Spanish Maritime Rescue now telling sailors to steer clear of the area  from April to August, stay close to the coast,  and don't try to harm the animals.

And breaking right now. The Pelican Island Causeway in Galveston is shut down after it was hit by a barge. A train trestle attached to the bridge appears to have collapsed onto that barge. The bridge is closed to public traffic in both directions. That we have seen first responders on the bridge itself over the last few minutes. On top of that, there's now an oil spill in this area. We're still working to learn what caused the bars to hit the bridge, but fortunately, no reports of any injuries at this time.

video_description: Thousands of parents and childcare providers across the U.S. are calling out of work or closing their doors for National Day Without Childcare, pressing lawmakers for affordable childcare and better pay for educators. According to @Care.com, the typical family spends 24% of their income on child care. #TODAYShow #parentsoftiktok
voice_to_text: Daycare facilities and preschools all across the country are closing their doors today as providers and parents join together  in a call to action demanding more affordable  and quality childcare for all families. For National Day Without Childcare. Pressing lawmakers for affordable childcare, including an expanded child tax credit  and better pay for educators. Childcare the second biggest expense  for working families after rent or mortgage. Care.com says the typical family spends nearly  a quarter of its income on childcare. Last year, 20% of parents reported shelling out at least  $3,000 a month or $36,000 a year. I've been traveling to swing states  and asking people, “What concerns you? What’s happening in your world? Why don't you feel what is on paper  is a strong economy?” This is one of the number one things  they tell me about. It's a huge part of someone's salary. Their ability to work, the decision whether to, affects the economy at large. Absolutely.  You can't work if you don't have quality childcare, and it takes up so much of the paycheck.

voice_to_text: It is the middle of may and 2024, and people are still walking around with masks on. COVID was literally four years ago. Four years ago, everybody shut down everything. Four years ago, people were acting as if the air was going to kill them. And I thought that we were all over this. I thought that we realized exactly what was going on during the COVID pandemic. But no, people are still walking around with masks on. People are still afraid of the air. It is wild to me that people are still operating under that delusion in may of 2024.

video_description: Hmm bakalan naik nggak ya? Presiden Jokowi akan menghapus sistem kelas 1, 2, dan 3 di BPJS Kesehatan. Sebagai gantinya, seluruh rumah sakit wajib menerapkan Kelas Rawat Inap Standar (KRIS) paling lambat 30 Juni 2025. Iuran BPJS Kesehatan selama ini dibedakan sesuai kelasnya, yakni untuk Kelas III Rp 42.000 per bulan. Tapi per 1 Januari 2021 dapat subsidi pemerintah Rp 7.000, jadi hanya Rp 35.000 per bulan. Kemudian Kelas II Rp 100.000 per bulan dan Kelas I Rp 150.000 per bulan. Direktur Keuangan dan Investasi BPJS Kesehatan, Arief Witjaksono Juwono, mengatakan untuk penggolongan iuran program Jaminan Kesehatan Nasional (JKN) BPJS Kesehatan dengan format baru nantinya menunggu keputusan pemerintah. “Kita menunggu dari pemerintah bagaimana apakah konsekuensi single class itu nanti single iuran, kita belum tahu. Ini masih berprogres,” kata Arief saat ditemui di Masjid At Tanwir PP Muhammadiyah, Jakarta, Senin (13/5). 📸: Dok. kumparan/Akbar Maulana. #bisnisupdate #update #bisnis #svt #bpjs #jokowi #iuran #kris #info #infoterkini #berita #beritaterkini #kumparan #tiktokberita

video_description: Mantan Ketua Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) Agus Rahardjo mengungkapkan salah satu masalah yang dihadapi ketika memimpin lembaga antirasuah adalah terlalu banyaknya orang berafiliasi dengan pihak luar KPK.  Menurut Agus, persoalan ini menjadi salah satu batu sandungan yang dihadapinya ketika baru menjabat Ketua KPK 2015-2019.  Berkaca dari situasi semacam itu, Agus berharap pimpinan KPK yang terpilih nantinya tidak ada perwakilan dari Kejaksaan maupun kepolisian.  #KPK #AgusRahardjo #KetuaKPK #JernihkanHarapan

Pimpinan Pondok Pesantren (Ponpes) NQW di Lombok berinisial MA diduga melecehkan lima santriwatinya. Kasus ini sudah dilaporkan ke Polres Lombok Barat. Ketua Lembaga Perlindungan Anak (LPA) Kota Mataram, Joko Jumadi, yang mendampingi para korban, MA membantah sebagai pelaku pelecehan terhadap lima orang santriwati. MA malah berdalih hal itu dilakukan oleh makhluk gaib. Pernyataan MA tersebut diperoleh LPA Kota Mataram dari keterangan orang tua korban dan santriwati yang mendapat pelecehan seksual. Mereka semua sempat dipertemukan dengan Pimpinan Ponpes NQW oleh tokoh masyarakat di Desa Persiapan Pesisir Mas, Kecamatan Sekotong, Lombok Barat, Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB). "Menurut cerita dari orang tua korban kemudian juga oleh korban yang sempat dipertemukan oleh tokoh masyarakat. Dalam pertemuan tersebut, MA tidak mengakui perbuatannya tapi mengatakan yang melakukannya makhluk gaib," kata Joko kepada wartawan di Mataram, Minggu (12/5). 📸: Dok. Polres Lombok Barat. #newsupdate #update #news #videonews #ponpes #pesantren #santriwati #info #infoterkini #beritaterkini #kumparan

video_description: Pengemudi ojek online ramai-ramai menggeruduk bengkel tambal ban yang diduga sebagai penebar paku di kawasan Bidara Cina, Jakarta Timur, Sabtu (11/5). Momen ini dibagikan oleh Angga di Instagram pribadinya, @usmanto89. Angga merupakan salah satu pengemudi ojek online yang ikut menggeruduk. Dalam video tersebut tampak 10 pengemudi ojek online menggerebek bengkel tersebut dan menemukan satu plastik berisi paku dan rangka payung. “Ditemukan paket bungkusan plastik hitam dan putih dalamnya isinya ranjau rangka payung deket lapak pangkalan tambal ban yang mangkal deket rumah susun Bidara Cina arah ke Halim,” kata Angga saat dikonfirmasi kumparan, Minggu (12/5). 📸: Dok. Instagram @/usmanto89. #newsupdate #update #news #svl #paku #jalan #ojekonline #tambalban #info #infoterkini #beritaterkini #kumparan

Tarif parkir liar mobil di kawasan Masjid Istiqlal diketok Rp 150 ribu. Hal tersebut dialami oleh seorang warga, lalu diunggah ke media sosial dan viral. Video yang diunggah itu memperlihatkan perdebatan antara sopir dengan sejumlah juru parkir liar di kawasan Masjid Istiqlal, Jakarta Pusat. Mereka berdebat soal tarif parkir mobil yang dipatok dengan harga fantastis, Rp 150 ribu. Sopir memprotes harga parkir yang dirasa terlalu tinggi kepada juru parkir liar. Namun jukir di video mengaku harga itu normal sebab sudah bersih tidak dipungut biaya yang lain seperti kebersihan dan lain-lain. kumparan pun mencoba menelusuri kawasan parkir liar di depan Masjid Istiqlal. Seorang juru parkir yang tidak ingin disebutkan namanya mengatakan, harga parkir untuk mobil pribadi sebenarnya hanya Rp 20 ribu saja. 📸: Dok. AKA (13) seorang santri di Lamongan dianiaya oleh tiga temannya. Korban yang merupakan laki-laki itu diikat lalu diangkat oleh temannya. AKA terjatuh hingga terluka di telinga.⁠ ⁠ Peristiwa itu terjadi di Ponpes Matholiul Anwar Jalan Raya Simo, Desa Sungelebak, Kecamatan Karanggeneng, Kabupaten Lamongan, pada Minggu (5/5) sekitar pukul 21.00 WIB.⁠ ⁠ "Ketiga santri dan juga korban yang bersangkutan sudah ditanyai. Jadi, kejadian tersebut bisa terjadi disebabkan lantaran guyonan (bercanda)," papar pengurus Ponpes Matholi'ul Anwar, Abdulloh Faqih, Minggu (12/5).⁠ ⁠ "Dia diikat itu benar. Tapi, kalau dibanting sampai tak sadarkan diri itu tidak benar. Posisinya korban ini diangkat bertiga, lalu jatuh begitu saja," terang Faqih. Setelah kejadian itu korban didampingi pembina dibawa ke klinik dan pihak klinik mengatakan korban tidak apa-apa. Saat ini, polisi masih melakukan pendalaman terkait penganiayaan tersebut.⁠ ⁠ 📸: Dok. mili.id, Shutterstock/Ilustrasi.⁠ ⁠ #focus #santrilamongan #news #videonews #santri #lamongan #ponpes #pondokpesantren #info #infoterkini #berita #beritaterkini #kumparan

video_description: The trust funds the Social Security Administration relies on to pay benefits are now projected to run out in 2035, one year later than previously projected, according to the annual trustees’ report. Read more at the #linkinbio. #cnbc
voice_to_text: John, new government estimates this afternoon show the Social Security trust funds that support recovery and disability benefits are set to be depleted by 2035. Now, that is one year later than forecast last year, and at that time the fund would only be able to pay out about 83% of benefits. On the Medicare side, there's a slightly better outlook. The Hospital Insurance Trust Fund that covers hospital stays will be able to pay 100% of benefits until 2036. That's five years longer than previous estimates. Now, the Treasury Department says that these upward adjustments are mostly due to a stronger than expected economy as compared to last year's forecast. More Americans are working and they're earning more money, and they're therefore contributing more money through their taxes to these programs. Surgery is also assuming a lower long term disability rate in these programs, so both increased revenue and reduce cost here are helping extend these timelines. Despite the improvement from last year, though, it's still clear that these programs will have to start paying less than full benefits out to about 70 million recipients in just over a decade unless Congress makes some sort of a change before then.

President Biden on Thursday condemned protests on college campuses that have turned violent or hateful, saying “there’s the right to protest, but not the right to cause chaos.”   “Peaceful protest is in the best tradition of how Americans respond to consequential issues, but neither are we a lawless country,” he said in remarks from the White House. “We are a civil society and order must prevail.”   The president’s message came as pro-Palestinian demonstrations and counterprotests have roiled campuses throughout the country. Students have set up encampments and issued demands that schools divest from Israel. On many campuses, police have been called in to respond to violence and property destruction.   “Destroying property is not a peaceful protest — it’s against the law,” he said. “Vandalism, trespassing, breaking windows, shutting down campuses, forcing the cancelation of classes and graduations — none of this is a peaceful protest.”   President Biden said “dissent is essential to democracy” but that dissent must not turn in lawlessness or bigotry.   “There should be no place on any campus, no place in America, for antisemitism or threats of violence against Jewish students,” he said. “There is no place for hate speech or violence of any kind whether it’s antisemitism, Islamophobia, or discrimination against Arab Americans or Palestinian Americans. It’s simply wrong.”   Responding to reporters’ questions, the president said the protests have not made him reconsider any policies with respect to the war in Gaza.   He also said “no” when asked whether the National Guard should be deployed to campuses to quell the demonstrations.” #potus #joebiden #protests #gazawar #israelhamaswar #cspan

video_description: Antony Blinken says there is currently a ceasefire proposal “on the table” US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said the US is “determined” to achieve a hostage exchange and ceasefire deal “now” during his visit to Tel Aviv on Wednesday. Blinken arrived in Israel on Tuesday for talks with Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other officials following visits to Jordan and Saudi Arabia, his seventh trip to the region since the beginning of Israel’s offensive on Gaza. Speaking jointly to reporters during the visit, Israeli President Isaac Herzog urged Israel’s "allies and friends" to reject efforts by the International Criminal Court (ICC) taken against the country for its war on Gaza. Herzog characterised the reported ICC investigation into Israeli leaders as a "clear and present danger to democracies and to free and peace-loving nations, who pursue the norms of international law". Recently, several senior Israeli officials have voiced concern over the ICC's investigation into Israel’s actions in Gaza and the occupied West Bank. Reports suggest that the court could issue arrest warrants for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and other Israeli leaders. Israel’s war on Gaza has killed over 34,500 Palestinians since 7 October 2023, the majority being women and children.

The Home Office has begun detaining migrants in amount for the first flights. Rishi Sunak claims they will take off by July. Labor have called the Rwanda schema gimmick and a waste of money. video_description: Could your favorite artist's streams be skyrocketing because of fake plays? Spotify thinks so. Here's how streaming farms like these have taken over charts and shut out smaller artists. #Reacts #streaming #musicindustry #streams #billboardcharts
voice_to_text: This is what a streaming farm looks like, aka the black market of the music industry. It's how some musicians and labels distort reality to push their tracks to the top of the charts and earn more money. Streaming farms use bots to artificially play music on platforms like Spotify or Apple Music to drastically inflate the numbers of streams a song gets. In March, a man in Denmark was sentenced to 18 months in prison for getting music streaming services to pay him $290,000 in royalties for fake streams. But that rare case is just a glimpse into the scale of this fraud. In 2,019 Rolling Stone article, Hopeless Records founder Louis Posin claimed this illegal practice potentially steals $300 million a year from artists with legitimate streams from real fans, equaling 3 to 4% of all streams. But that estimate is much higher now. A 2023 analyst report from the Financial Times found that up to 10% of all music streams globally are fake. Matters because there's a pool of money that streaming platforms distribute to the rights holders of songs. So when an artist is faking those dreams, they're taking money out of that pool could go to artists with legitimate streams. The creation of streaming farms follows the decline of radio and the rise of its replacement streaming platforms. Major artists and labels historically paid radio DJs to play their music. But streaming platforms like Spotify are democratizing music, allowing independent artists a platform. But that means Larger artists and labels are struggling to stay on top of the charts, so they compete by buying streams. Streaming services like Spotify have recently tried to crack down on this by looking specifically for erratic behavior like a sudden jumping streams or song on repeat for hours. A Spotify spokesperson said that when they detect artificial streams, they withhold royalties and tell the labeler distributor. They can also choose to remove tracks from the platform and find labels in distributor, but some musicians say they're being targeted by bots and then unfairly punished as a result. Marketing agencies hired by the artist might be responsible though, going behind the backs of the artist to fulfill their promises. Apple Music has similarly been penalizing streaming fraud 2 since 2022, but somehow people are continuing to steal from the royalty pool, which is already too small and meant for artists with real fans. And with advancements in AI, who knows what the scale of this issue could actually be now and in the future.
